Original Title: The Killers
Year: 1964
Length: 95 min.
Country: United States
Directed: Don Siegel
Written: Gene L. Coon (Story: Ernest Hemingway)
Music: John Williams
Photo: Richard L. Rawlings
Cast: Lee Marvin, Angie Dickinson, John Cassavetes, Ronald Reagan, Clu Gulager, Claude Akins, Norman Fell, Don Haggerty, Robert Phillips
Studio: Universal Pictures
Genre: Film black. Mystery | Detective. Crime. remake

Synopsis:
---------
Two murderers are commissioned to end the life of a former racing driver. Executed work, one of them, intrigued, decided to find out why the victim did not even try to defend themselves or flee. The investigation leads him to one of the organized crime bosses. This is the second adaptation of the short story "The Killers" by Ernest Hemingway. The first ("Outlaws", 1946), the undisputed masterpiece of black film was directed by Robert Siodmak and starring Burt Lancaster ("Swedish").
